title: Total set
summary: In functional analysis, a total set (also called a complete set) in a vector space is a set of linear functionals T {\displaystyle T} with the property that if a vector x ∈ X {\displaystyle x\in X} satisfies f ( x ) = 0 {\displaystyle f(x)=0} for all f ∈ T , {\displaystyle f\in T,} then x = 0 {\displaystyle x=0} is the zero vector.[1]
